name: Article in conference proceedings
description: Academic paper presented at a conference and published in the proceedings

name: Journal article
description: Peer-reviewed academic article published in a scholarly journal

name: Chapter in edited volume
description: Individual chapter contributed to an edited book or collection

name: Thesis
description: Academic dissertation or thesis submitted for a degree

name: Informational Booklet
description: Short printed materials (1-8 pages) providing concise information, promotional content, or summaries
consolidation_reason: All are short-form printed materials (1-8 pages). In practice, these terms are used interchangeably. The distinctions between 'booklet', 'brochure', 'factsheet', and 'flyer' are format minutiae, not meaningful content differences. Users searching for concise printed information don't benefit from these granular distinctions.

name: Guide/Manual
description: Comprehensive reference materials providing instructions, guidance, and detailed information
consolidation_reason: In modern usage, 'handbook' and 'manual' are synonymous - both provide detailed instructions and reference information. 'Guide' is slightly broader but functionally overlaps significantly. From a user perspective searching for instructions, these distinctions are arbitrary.

name: Tutorial
description: Step-by-step instructional content for learning a specific skill or process
note: Kept separate from Guide/Manual due to its specific instructional/step-by-step learning focus

name: Technical Report
description: Formal technical documentation including project reports, research papers, reviews, specifications, and technical articles
consolidation_reason: These six categories are all variations of technical documentation. 'Deliverable' and 'milestone' are project management terms, not content types. 'Report/paper', 'review document', 'technical article', and 'tech specs' are all formal technical documents differing mainly in length/scope. The distinctions fragment technical content and confuse users searching for technical information.

name: Presentation
description: Slide-based presentations for any purpose: informational, educational, decision-making, or motivational
consolidation_reason: Consolidating presentation types from both Document (Practice abstract) and Slideshow/Presentation category (Decision-making, Educational, Informative, Motivational). Purpose-based distinctions are too granularâ€”a single presentation can serve multiple purposes. The common factor is the format (slide deck). Users searching for presentations want all slide-based content, not filtering by assumed purpose.

name: News & Communication
description: Time-sensitive communication documents including newsletters, press releases, and policy briefs
consolidation_reason: All three are time-sensitive communication documents. 'Newsletter' (periodic updates), 'Press release' (public announcements), and 'Policy brief' (concise policy communication) serve similar communication purposes. The distinctions are organizational/audience-based rather than content-type based. Users looking for current updates benefit from unified discovery.
